name: Location of facilities within areas given in MRTS 28.1 Cl. 1 or through private arrangements.
Properly constructed toilets, rubbish receptacles and wash facilities provided.

If stated in Clause 2 of MRTS28.1, a separate room shall be provided for the use of auditing, QA documentation and private meetings with the Administrator and Principal. The requirements of the room shall be as stated in Clause 4.4.1 of MRTS28.

If stated in Clause 3 of MRTS28.1, a separate room shall be provided for the exclusive use of the administrator during Work Under the Contract. The requirements of the room shall be as stated in Clause 3 of MRTS28.1
If stated in Clause 4 of MRTS28.1, documentation of the Contractor's site facilities shall be provided to the Administrator for approval.
If stated in Clause 5 of MRTS28.1, the Contractor's site facilities shall be screened from public view.
Camp and facilities provide safe egress and ingress and do not impact on existing through traffic.
If no area's are included in Cl6 MRTS 28.1 the contractor shall be responsible for obtaining any necessary area's for the establishment of a camp.
Contractors camp complies with all requirements of MRTS28 annexure, including any supplementary requirements.

If private property is to be used for the Contractor's facilities, written approval must be sought from the property owner and provided to the Administrator for approval. Restoration of these areas shall be in accordance with MRTS16, MRTS28 and MRTS51 and a plan shall be submitted to the Administrator for approval prior to commencement.

Geotextile strength and filtration classes as specified on drawings or within MRTS27
Geotextile stored on site under protective covers, off the ground and in a manner unaffected by heat. Rolls clearly marked with manufacturer, type and batch.
Proposed Geotextile submitted to and accepted by Adminstrator for acceptability to Cl6.
Geotextiles installed as specified in the contract
Area cleared and graded with all sharp objects and large stones removed and covered within 48hours of being placed
Initial uncompacted layer thickness for fill material placed over the geotextile shall be not less than 200mm of D85 of the fill material, whichever is greater.

Jointing of geotextiles in accordance with clause 9.3. If overlap is not specified, it shall be a minimum of 500mm. If used to line subsoil drainage trenches, the geotextile shall fully envelop the drainage material with a minimum 300mm overlap at the top of the trench.

Filling over installed geotextile shall be in accordance with clause 9.4. No construction equipment shall stand or travel directly on the laid geotextile. Rock placed directly on geotextile shall be placed with a drop height not exceeding 1.5m.

Where batch size is <5000m2, sampling and testing need not be undertaken, provided the nominal strength of the material supplied is 20% higher than the requirements and the filtration properties are 20% lower than the requirements stated.
Where directed, a testing sample shall be cut and provided to the administrator
Sampled geotextile shall be tested by the Contractor for the range of properties specified in Table 6.2 and Table 6.3 in accordance with the requirements of Clause 10.3.
Geotextile not placed until administrator accepts test results
The administrator may select samples from the site for audit testing.

14.20 - Installation of Steel beam Guardrail and End Treatments (Public Domain)
template name: 14.20 - Installation of Steel beam Guardrail and End Treatments (Public Domain)

name: Manufacture of steel beam guardrail post, panel components and end treatments are maufactured by an approved manufacturer
Supply of steel beam guardrail post, panel components and end treatments are supplied by an approved supplier
All the steel manufacturer test certificates shall be supplied to the Administrator. The Administrator shall review and approve the certificates.
If test certificates are not available, the Contractor shall submit to the Administrator for approval a proposal for selecting samples for testing.
All projects are to be supplied with a min. two extra posts and panels from each batch. The Administrator shall randomly select from each batch two post and two panels for Audit testing.
Installation shall not commence until the Administrator has confirmed the materials tested match the material test certificates supplied.
All welders must comply with the requirements of Clause 20.5.2 otherwise a TMR representative shall be present when macro samples are prepared to show conformorance
Steel Beam guardrail installed in the locations shown in the design documentation and in accordance with the Standard Drawings
Steel Posts driven into ground except where posts are to be driven into asphalt, concrete or rock.
Where ground is asphalt, concrete or rock, a hole shall be excavated in accordane with Cl 20.6.2
Terminals installed as per the design documentation
Delinerators installed on steel beam guardrail in accordance with the MUTCD Part 2
Adminstrator accepts guardrail installation as per the design documentation

14.21 - Installation of Steel beam Guardrail and End Treatments (Proprietary Systems)
template name: 14.21 - Installation of Steel beam Guardrail and End Treatments (Proprietary Systems)

name: Proprietary road safety barrier systems and/or end treatment shall be manufactured, fabricated and assembled in accordance with the design and specifications provided by the system and/or device designer.
The installer of proprietary road safety systems shall provide the required quality documentation in accordance with clause 21.2 to the Administrator.
Proprietary barrier systems shall be installed as shown in and required by the design documentation and in accordance with the requirements of the installation manual.

Where the design of the system is provided by the Contractor, the design, installation drawings, specifications and evidence and conditions of acceptance for use on state-controlled roads in Queensland shall be provided to the Administrator prior to commencement of installation.
Delineation shall conform to the requirements of Clause 10.2.4 of MRTS14 and shall be installed in accordance with Part 2 of the MUTCD.

Proprietary systems shall be installed in accordance with the tolerances specified by the supplier. Where not specified, the alignment shall not deviate from the design by more than 20mm and the height shall not deviate by more than 10mm from the design.

The quality records of proprietary systems shall include:
- Evidence and conditions of acceptance for use on state-controlled roads in Queensland
- Supplier's instructions or procedures for the installation and ongoing maintenance and repair
- Details of the country of manufacture of all components
- Quality documentation showing the supplied components are in accordance with the supplier's specification
- A copy of the detailed design (where not provided by the Principal)
